Description: Security researchers discover using the BSSID (Basic Service Set Identifier) to geo-locate infected hosts.

Author: Conti
Description: Gastroenterology Consultants Ltd have some data dumped from the Conti ransomware group
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Mount Locker
Description: Dassault Falcon Jet discloses a data breach after a Mount Locker ransomware attack, that may have led to the exposure of personal information belonging to current and former employees, as well as their spouses and dependents.

Author: Mount Locker
Description: Amey Plc, the British company providing infrastructure support services reveals to have suffered a ransomware attack since mid-December 2020.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: Thallium
Description: Researchers from ESTsecurity reveal that North Korean hacking group Thallium has targeted users of a private stock investment messenger service.
Target: Users of a private stock investment messenger service

Description: This week a threat actor leaks the data of 10,000 Mexico-based American Express credit cardholders on a forum.
The same threat actor leaks the data of several Santander credit cardholders
The same threat actor leaks the data of several Banamex credit cardholders
A new SMS text phishing (smishing) campaign pretends to be from PayPal, stating that the victim's account has been permanently limited unless they verify it by clicking on a link.
Researchers from Cyble discover a trove of more than 200 million records of Chinese citizens for sale on the dark web. The alleged leaks could be related to Gongan County, Weibo, and QQ.
Aurora Cannabis says it experienced a “cybersecurity incident” over the holidays. The incident took place on Dec. 25.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Exclusive Networks reveals it has been hit by a cyber breach, affecting the cyber security distributor's systems across five countries (UK, US, France, Singapore, and the UAE) with the breach resulting in unauthorized access to data.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: APT27, AKA TG-3390, Emissary Panda, BRONZE UNION, Iron Tiger, and LuckyMouse.
Description: Researchers from Profero and Security Joes reveal the details of a ransomware campaign involving APT28, a Chinese group normally involved in cyber espionage operations.
Target: At least five companies in the online gambling sector

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: A research from Kela reveals finds nearly 1 million compromised accounts pertaining to gaming clients and employees in the dark web, with 50% of them offered for sale.

Author: FIN7
Description: Researchers at Morphisec Labs publish details about a malware variant called JSSLoader used by the FIN7 hacking group.

Multiple code repositories from Nissan North America become public after the company leaves an exposed Git server protected with default access credentials. The entire collection is around 20 gigabytes large and contains source code for mobile apps and various tools used by Nissan.

Researchers from Intezer discover a new remote access trojan, dubbed ElectroRAT, written in Golang, that lures cryptocurrency users to download trojanized apps on Windows, Mac and Linux machines by promoting the apps in dedicated online forums and on social media.

Author: Earth Wendigo
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new campaign targeting several organizations, including government organizations, research institutions and universities in Taiwan, aiming to exfiltrate emails from targeted organizations via the injection of JavaScript backdoors to a webmail system that is widely-used in Taiwan.
Target: Government organizations, research institutions and universities in Taiwan

Author: Babuk Locker
Description: Several security researchers discover Babuk Locker, the first ransomware operation of 2021.

Author: Avaddon
Description: The Belgian consultancy firm Finalyse emerges unscathed from an Avaddon ransomware attack being able to restore the data from a backup despite the group leaks 98 GB of data.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) warns about a social engineering campaign featuring phishing emails and scam calls that impersonate the ACSC.

Author: APT37 AKA ScarCruft, Reaper, and Group123
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal the details of a campaign carried out by the North Korean group APT37, targeting the South Korean government via the RokRat trojan.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Egregor
Description: The FBI sends a security alert warning private sector companies that the Egregor ransomware operation is actively targeting and extorting businesses worldwide.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors are actively scanning the Internet for open SSH devices and trying to login to them using a new recently patched Zyxel hardcoded credential backdoor.
Researchers from Trustwave reveal the details of a new phishing campaign distribution the QRAT malware via a fake video of the President Donald Trump.
The Ben-Gurion University reveals to have been hit with a cyber attack.

Window to the World Communications alerts employees to the discovery of a data breach in its computer system.. Emails and personal information of approximately 40 staffers were hacked between December 2018 and August 2020
The Taiwanese National Communications Commission (NCC) orders Taiwan Mobile to recall all of its self-branded, China-made smartphones after the phones’ built-in software is found to contain malware.

Author: ALTDOS
Description: Threat actors calling themselves ALTDOS claim to have hacked several companies of the Mono conglomerate, being able to exfiltrate hundreds of gigabytes of data and asking a ransom for the data.
Security researchers at AT&T’s Alien Labs identify multiple malware attacks leveraging the Ezuri memory loader to execute payloads without writing them to disk.

Author: TA551, AKA Shathak
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Unit 42 reveal the details of a new campaign targeting German, Italian and Japanese speakers with the IcedID info-stealer.

The Royal Dutch Touring Club sends an email to former and current members to warn them that their data may have been compromised in a cyber attack, not directly on their systems but on a collection agency (Trust Krediet Beheer BV).

Author: TeamTNT
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new version of the TeamTNT botnet able to collect Docker API credentials, on top of the AWS creds-stealing code.

Author: Charming Kitten (APT35 or Phosphorus)
Description: Researchers from CERTFA discover a new campaign by the Iranian cyber-espionage group Charming Kitten targeting individuals from all over the world using a very sophisticated spear-phishing campaign that involved not only email attacks but also SMS messages.
Target: Members of think tanks, political research centers, university professors, journalists, and environmental activists

Description: the Montreal carsharing service Communauto notifies to have suffered a ransomware attack.

Tasmania’s ambulance paging system is breached exposing the records of every Tasmanian that has requested an ambulance since November 2020. The breached sensitive data is published online to an undisclosed website that is then blocked.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Conti
Description: Colorado-based short line rail operator and logistics provider OmniTRAX was is by a Conti ransomware attack
Reserve Bank of New Zealand reveals that a file sharing service provided by California-based Accellion was illegally accessed.
Bollywood actress Esha Deol has her Instagram account hacked and warns her followers not to click on links from her direct messages (DMs) due to the hack

Email security provider Mimecast discloses that hackers had hijacked its products in order to spy on its customers, after “a sophisticated threat actor” had compromised the certificate used to guard connections between its products and Microsoft’s cloud services. Around 10% of its more than 36,000 customers had been affected, but it believed “a low single digit number” of users had been specifically targeted.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: 5 million records (usernames and passwords) of French users are on sale on a black market.
A threat actor claims to have leaked about 1 million records stoken by the Canadian telco company Vidèotron

Networking device maker Ubiquiti Networks announces a security incident that may have exposed customers' data. The company emails customers to change their passwords and enable 2FA after an attacker hacked their systems hosted at a third-party cloud provider.
Researchers from Sentinel One reveal the details of s cryptocurrency mining campaign targeting macOS using a malware called macOS.OSAMiner, using run-only AppleScript files to avoid detections.
A security researcher reveals that a hacker took control of people's internet-connected chastity cages and demanded a ransom to be paid in Bitcoin to unlock it.
The personal information of roughly 2,550 people is compromised by a “phishing” attack on the email account of an employee at Jefferson Healthcare.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: AKVA group reveals in statement on the Oslo Stock Exchange to have been hit by a ransomware attack.

Author: ALTDOS
Description: ALTDOS claims to have acquired 8 million records from 3BB a broadband service provider in Thailand.

Author: Conti
Description: Warren-Washington-Albany ARC has some data leaked by the Conti ransomware gang.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: REvil AKA Sodinokibi
Description: Dental Health Associates, P.A. has some data leaked from the REvil ransomware group.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Egregor
Description: An unconfirmed Australian dental surgery practice has its data dumped by the Egregor ransomware group.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Egregor
Description: Coldwater Orthodontics has its data dumped by the Egregor ransomware group.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Egregor
Description: Delta Dental Plans Association has its data dumped by the Egregor ransomware group.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Google's Project Zero reveals the details of a hacking campaign coordinated by "a highly sophisticated actor" and targeting Windows and Android users with multiple zero-day and n-day exploits.
Microsoft patches 83 vulnerabilities, including CVE-2021-1647, a zero-day vulnerability in the Microsoft Defender antivirus, which Microsoft said was exploited before today's patches were released.

Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Operation Spalax, a wave of attacks against companies and government institutions in Colombia with a combination of remote access tools: Remcos, njRAT, and AsyncRAT.
Target: Government institutions and private companies, especially from the energy and metallurgical industries in Colombia

Author: Triangulum
Description: Researchers from Check Point reveal the details of Rogue, a new form of malware combination of two previous families of Android RATs – Cosmos and Hawkshaw.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Facebook says it removed 1,957 Facebook accounts, 707 Instagram accounts, 156 pages and 727 groups last month for misleading users about their purpose and identity.

Author: Chimera
Description: Researchers from NCC Group and Fox-IT reveal the details of Chimera, a threat group with a wide set of interests, from intellectual property (IP) from victims in the semiconductors industry through to passenger data from the airline industry.
Target: Victims in the semiconductors and airline industry

Description: Researchers from SophosLabs discover a small cluster of Trojanized versions of Android apps, focused on stealing sensitive data from the phones of Pakistani residents.
Unknown hackers disrupt the operations of the Hospital of Horažďovice.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Ultrapar notifies to have been hit by a cyber attack.
Target_class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Description: The Puget Sound Educational Service District (PSESD) sends out a notice to current and former students, and employees of King and Pierce County Schools, after learning of a data breach within their computer network.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC) provides information about a ransomware attack.

Energy supplier Eneco warns former customers of a possible data breach when cyber criminals manage to gain access to the accounts of 1,700 customers and that personal information may have been stolen. As a precaution the company asks a separate group of 47,000 customers to change their password.
Target_class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Description: A malware attack infects all of Clearfield County’s servers and 15 percent of its computers.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Precision Spine Care is the victim of a phishing attack.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Attack: Multiple techniques including phishing, brute force login attempts, and a 'pass-the-cookie' attack.
Description: The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns of a wave of attacks where that threat actors bypassed multi-factor authentication (MFA) authentication protocols to compromise cloud service accounts.
South Country Health Alliance, notifies 66,000 members that their personal information was exposed during a phishing attack on an employee email account last June.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The FBI issues a Private Industry Notification (PIN) to warn of attacks targeting enterprises, in which threat actors attempt to obtain employee credentials through vishing or chat rooms.
A new phishing campaign utilizes the Windows Finger command to download the MineBridge backdoor malware.

Author: At least 40 cybercriminal gangs
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal that at least 40 cybercriminal gangs are using Classiscam, a scam-as-a-service that relies on Telegram bots to provide pages that impersonate popular classifieds, marketplaces, and delivery services.
A new wave of account takeovers for multiple verified Twitter accounts promotes an Elon Musk cryptocurrency giveaway scam.

Author: Winnti group (AKA APT41)
Description: Researchers from Positive Technologies reveal the details of the latest campaign by the Chinese state-sponsored Winnti group using multiple backdoors.
Target: Multiple organizations in Russia and Hong Kong.

Author: Oink and Stuff
Description: Facebook files legal action against two Chrome extension developers that the company said were scraping user profile data – including names and profile IDs – as well as other browser-related information.
The Ronald McDonald House notifies 17,373 guests to have been impacted by the Blackbaud ransomware breach.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The National Detergent Company in Oman is it by a cyber attack that caused the loss of some data.

Researchers from Proofpoint discover a large BEC campaign (thousands of emails) spoofing executives and attempting to illicit the recipient's support in a bogus merger and/or acquisition, projecting that COVID-19 vaccines would fuel the world's economic recovery.
Target: Executive roles in companies located primarily in the United States.

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a phishing campaign urging the potential victims to click a link to "confirm their email to receive the vaccine". The goal of this phishing campaign was to steal Office 365 login credentials.
Target: Dozens of different industries in United States and Canada

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover another small (under 100 emails) BEC email campaign, picking vaccine lures in an attempt to exploit their targets.
Target: Various industries in the United States

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a medium-sized (several hundred messages) email campaign distributing the AgentTesla keylogger via fake World Health Organization emails.
Target: Various industries in the United States

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint observe a medium-sized (hundreds of messages) campaign, urging the potential victims to click a fake DHL link.
Target: Dozens of different industries in the United States, Germany, and Austria

Author: Egregor
Description: Mortgage loan servicing company SN Servicing Corporation notifies at least two states of a ransomware attack on its systems.
Google removes 164 Android applications from the official Play Store after security researchers from White Ops discover the apps bombarding users with out-of-context ads.
The Center for Alternative Sentencing and Employment Services (CASES) notifies its clients of data breach caused buy a phishing attack.
Target: Center for Alternative Sentencing and Employment Services (CASES)
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Hendrick Health System notifies patients that some identifying information may have been compromised during a network security breach apparently due to a ransomware attack. 640,000 individuals are potentially affected.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Gainwell Technologies announces that someone may have gained unauthorized access to some participants’ information in Wisconsin’s Medicaid program.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Someone gains unauthorized access to a video lesson for second-year students.
Target: Undisclosed school in County Meath Ireland

Author: Iranian threat actors
Description: The FBI is warning that the Iranian-linked cyber operation called "Enemies of the People" continues to threaten federal and state officials as well U.S. civilians.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Russian, Iranian and Chinese influence actors
Description: The FBI, Department of Homeland Security and eight other agencies warns that "Russian, Iranian and Chinese influence actors are exploiting the U.S. Capitol siege to amplify narratives in furtherance of their policy interest amid the presidential transition.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The Atlanta synagogue The Temple is disrupted by a cyber attack.
The OpenWRT forum, a large community of enthusiasts of alternative, open-source operating systems for routers, announced a data breach.

Author: DeroHE
Description: Windows utility developer IObit is hacked to perform a widespread attack to distribute the strange DeroHE ransomware to its forum members.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The prestigious Wentworth golf and country club warns its 4000 members that their personal details may have fallen into the hands of hackers following a ransomware attack.
The CHwapi Hospital in Belgium is hit with a Windows BitLocker attack where threat actors claim to have encrypted 40 servers and 100 TB of data.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a leak of 500K+ records of C-level people from Capital Economics on a Russian-speaking forum.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The Okanogan County is hit with a cyber attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: StellarParticle (AKA UNC2452, Dark Halo)
Description: Cybersecurity firm Malwarebytes confirms that the threat actor behind the SolarWinds supply-chain attack were able to gain access to some company emails.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: FreakOut
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover an active malicious campaign, currently targeting Linux devices running software with critical vulnerabilities.
Researchers from Onapsis detect automated probes for servers containing CVE-2020-6207, a severe vulnerability in SAP, a week after a working exploit was published online.

Author: ALTDOS
Description: Hackers from ALTDOS claim to have successfully attacked BEXIMCO.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: The Diponegoro University (pak.undip.ac.id) admits that there have been several attempts to breach its servers after 125,000 student's data is leaked.

Author: Ryuk
Description: Salem Clinic and the Oregon Heart Center notify patients that their protected health information was exposed during a May 2019 ransomware attack targeting their mailing service provider.
Target: Salem Clinic and the Oregon Heart Center
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: ShinyHunters
Description: ShinyHunters share a database that he claims was stolen from Pixlr while he breached the 123rf stock photo site. Pixlr and 123rf are both owned by the same company, Inmagine.
An advisory from Netscout reveals that Windows Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) servers are now being abused by DDoS-for-hire services to amplify Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks.
Researchers from Media Trust reveal the details of LuckyBoy-3PC, a malvertising campaign deploying cloaking and obfuscation technologies.
Target: More than 10 Demand Side Platforms (DSP), primarily Europe-based

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a campaign sending thousands of messages using Google Forms to target retail, telecom, healthcare, energy and manufacturing companies in an apparent reconnaissance campaign to launch future business email compromises (BECs).
Target: Telecom, healthcare, energy and manufacturing companies

Author: Nefilim
Description: Colliers International Group, a Canadian real estate services firm, acknowledges that it suffered a cyberattack last November

Einstein Healthcare Network announces that it began mailing letters to patients whose information may have been involved in a data security incident involving unauthorized access to employees’ email accounts.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The vehicle rental company Ucar reveals that it had been the target of ransomware earlier this year.
The Butler County Sheriff's Office reveals to have been hit by a malware attack during the holiday season.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: CursedGrabber
Description: Researchers from Sonatype discover a new campaign carried out via three malicious npm packages distribiting the CursedGrabber malware.

Researchers from Check Point and Otorio reveal the details of a massive phishing campaign targeting thousands of organizations worldwide. However the attackers forget to protect their loot and let Google share the stolen passwords for public searches.
QNAP urges customers to secure their network-attached storage (NAS) devices against Dovecat, an ongoing malware campaign that infects and exploits them to mine bitcoin.
A new malware spreads through Whatsapp auto-replies to any messaging conversations using a malicious link that leads to a fake Huawei app.
The Goods and Services Tax Network (GSTN) announces a possible cyber attack with a cryptic tweet.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Breast Care Specialists take their systems offline after a cyberattack exposed patients' personal and medical information
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: ShinyHunters
Description: Bonobos men's clothing store suffers a massive data breach exposing millions of customers' personal information after a 70GB cloud backup of their database is downloaded and shared.
Security hardware manufacturer SonicWall issues an urgent security notice about threat actors exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in their VPN products to perform attacks on their internal systems.
Some of the laptops given out in England to support vulnerable children home-schooling during lockdown contain the Gamarue malware
A hacker is selling a database with login details for two million high-paying users of the MyFreeCams adult video streaming and chat service.
​Mobile network operator USCellular suffers a data breach after hackers gained access to its CRM and viewed customers' accounts.

Researchers from Zscaler reveal the details of the DreamBus botnet, a Linux-based malware family targeting a wide collection of apps, such as PostgreSQL, Redis, Hadoop YARN, Apache Spark, HashiCorp Consul, SaltStack, and the SSH service.
Target: Enterprise-level apps running on Linux systems

Author: Clop
Description: The7stars, an important London ad agency falls victim of a Clop ransomware attack.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The Department of Vienne is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: A database belonging to Santander Mexico is put on sale on an underground market. 1 million records are leaked.
A database belonging to BBVA Mexico is put on sale on an underground market. 3 million records are leaked.
A database belonging to IMSS, a Mexican marketing firm, is put on sale on an underground market. 42 million records are leaked.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The personal information of 220 million users in Brazil, belonging to Serasa (an Experian company) is leaked in the dark web.

The Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) reveals that one of its servers has been accessed by an unknown threat actor exploiting a vulnerability in the Accellion file transfer platform.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The city of Montmagne is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

The website of the bealthcare provider Vidal.fr is taken down after a threat actor leaks some data allegededly stolen on October 2020.

Author: Avaddon
Description: An undisclosed victim of the Avaddon ransomware gang suffers a DDoS attack after refusing to pay.

Author: ShinyHunters
Description: ShinyHunters leaks the stolen database for Indian cryptocurrency exchange Buyucoin on a hacking forum for free.

Author: ShinyHunters
Description: ShinyHunters leaks the details of more than 2.28 million users registered on MeetMindful.com.

Author: ZINC
Description: Researchers from Google (and few days later from Microsoft) reveal the details of a North Korean government-backed hacking group, targeting security researchers who focus on vulnerability and exploit development via social networks, disclosed Google tonight.

Austria-based crane manufacturer Palfinger informs customers that its IT infrastructure suffered serious disruptions as a result of an “ongoing global cyber attack.” The company confirms the nature of the attack as ransomware
American packaging giant WestRock informed customers that it was recently targeted in a ransomware attack that impacted both IT and OT systems.

Author: DeroHE
Description: Over the weekend, the ransomware actors from DeroHE hack again the IObit forums to display a message demanding that IObit pay them $100,000 in DERO or the attacks would continue.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: An active phishing campaign pretends to be from the UK's National Health Service (NHS), alerting recipients that they are eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.
Georgetown County says the county’s computer network “suffered a major infrastructure breach over the weekend.” Most of the county’s electronic systems, including emails, are impacted.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal the details of an ongoing phishing campaign delivering fake Office 365 password expiration reports that managed to compromise tens of C-Suite email accounts to date.
Researchers from AddressIntel discover a new Android malware dubbed Oscorp targeting Italian users.
Tennessee Wesleyan University is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: REvil AKA Sodinokibi
Description: Pan-Asian retail chain operator Dairy Farm Group is attacked by the REvil ransomware operation. The attackers claim to have demanded a $30 million ransom.

Author: Nemty
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal the details of a Nemty ransomware attack carried out exploiting the ghost account of a deceased administrator.
Apple releases security updates for iOS to patch three zero-day vulnerabilities exploited in the wild.

Researchers from Abnormal Security discover two business email compromise (BEC) attack techniques that exploit a Microsoft 365 “read receipt” message loophole to evade auto-remediation of a malicious email.

Researchers from Abnormal Security discover two business email compromise (BEC) attack techniques that exploit a Microsoft 365 “out of office” message loophole to evade auto-remediation of a malicious email.
Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new strain of DanaBot distributed through pirated software keys.
Researchers from FireEye discover a phishing campaign spoofing the DHL's delivery service, and using encrypted Telegram channel to exfiltrate data.

Researchers from RiskIQ reveal the details of LogoKit, a novel phishing toolkit that changes logos and text on a phishing page in real-time to adapt to targeted victims.
The Woodland Trust confirms that it was hit with a cyberattack describing the incident as "sophisticated" and "high level" – and it has taken many services offline.

Description: Serco, one of the companies involved in the NHS Test and Trace operations, confirms it has been hit by a ransomware attack.

The UK National Crime Agency (NCA) and National Cyber Crime Unit (NCCU discover and donate to the community a 225 million cache of stolen emails and passwords.

Cloudstar, a cloud hosting service and managed service provider for several industry sectors, is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Virginia Tech is hit with a ransomware attack. Apparently no data is stolen.
The cross-chain DeFi protocol THORChain suffers the second security breach in less than a month, with the attackers stealing $7.6 million worth of digital assets.
An attack on debit order collection company Qsure impacts several South African insurers who use its services.

Author: Kiprop
Description: The Kenya’s electoral body the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) is allegedly hacked, despite it dismisses the claims.
Target: Kenya’s Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC)
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Cl0p
Description: Community Memorial Health System's patients may have been affected by the Accellion cyberattack after its billing provider, Guidehouse, is affected by the same breach.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Multiple attackers
Description: Human rights non-governmental organization Amnesty International and non-profit project Forbidden Stories revealed in a recent report that they found spyware made by Israeli surveillance firm NSO Group deployed on iPhones running Apple's latest iOS release, hacked using zero-day zero-click iMessage exploits.
Target: Human rights defenders and journalists around the world

Description: Campbell Conroy & O'Neil, P.C. (Campbell), a US law firm counseling dozens of Fortune 500 and Global 500 companies, discloses a data breach following a February 2021 ransomware attack.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: Avos Locker
Description: The City of Geneva (Ohio) suffers a ransomware attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: ZeroX
Description: A threat actor group known as ZeroX is offering 1 TB of proprietary data belonging to Saudi Aramco for sale, allegedly stolen via a 0-day from a third-party contractor. The attackers reportedly demand $50M.
Target_class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Author: Haron
Description: Malware analysts from South Korean security firm S2W Labs discover Haron, a new ransomware operation that heavily borrows from past ransomware operations such as Thanos and the now-defunct Avaddon.
A new identity-theft campaign tries to take advantage of the partial collapse of the Champlain Towers South condo building in Surfside, stealing the identities of the victims.
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill School of Medicine (SOM) discloses a phishing attack.
Target: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill School of Medicine (SOM)

Description: Pionet, an Israeli IT company, suffers a ransomware attack.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: UNC Health and Chapel Hill School of Medicine notify 10,832 patients that their data may be exposed in a phishing attack,
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Chinese state-sponsored attackers
Description: A joint advisory issued by the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) reveals that Chinese state-sponsored attackers have breached 13 US oil and natural gas (ONG) pipeline companies between December 2011 to 2013 following a spear-phishing campaign targeting their employees.
Target: 13 US oil and natural gas (ONG) pipeline companies
Target_class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Author: MosaicLoader
Description: Researchers from BitDefender discover an ongoing worldwide campaign is pushing a new malware dubbed MosaicLoader camouflaged as cracked software via search engine advertising to infect wannabe software pirates' systems.
Researchers from Intezer reveal that threat actors are abusing misconfigured Argo Workflows instances to deploy cryptocurrency miners on Kubernetes clusters.
An apparent ransomware attack results in hundreds of self-service ticket machines across the network being taken offline across the north of England.

Author: Joker
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a total of 11 apps infected with the Joker malware and with 30,000 installs.
More than 2,000 UnitedHealthcare patients are being notified that their data has been potentially exposed after several phishing attacks launched on its broker Academic HealthPlans.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Orlando Family Physicians notifies 447,426 patients that it was the victim of a phishing attack on its employee email accounts.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: APT31 (AKA Zirconium)
Description: The French national cyber-security agency (ANSSI) warns of an ongoing series of attacks against a large number of French organizations coordinated by the Chinese-backed APT31 hacking group, carried out via a mesh of home routers.

Author: Multiple actors
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) releases an alert about 13 samples found on exploited Pulse Secure devices, largely undetected by antivirus products.
Researchers at ReversingLabs discover two malicious npm packages able to steal passwords from Chrome.
Researchers from Mbsd, a Japanese security firm, discover an Olympics-themed malware sample that contains functionality to wipe files on infected systems and appears to be targeted at Japanese PCs.
Login IDs and passwords for the Tokyo Olympic ticket portal are posted to a leak website following a breach.

Author: FIN7
Description: Researchers from eSentire reveal the details of a FIN7 campaign using a lure relating to a lawsuit against the owner of Jack Daniels whiskey.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: StrongPity AKA Promethium
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal the details of the latest campaign of the StrongPity APT, carried out via a malicious Android APK distributed via the Syrian e-government portal.
The town of Sunset Beach is attacked by a series of ransomware hacks.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: XCSSET
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new version of the XCSSET malware stealing Telegram accounts and Chrome passwords.

Author: LemonDuck
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal the details of a new version of the LemonDuck botnet, allowing hands-on-keyboard intrusions.
Researchers from Avanan reveal the details of a phishing campaign hosting the content on Milanote, an application defined as the "Evernote for Creatives".

Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that scammers are taking advantage of the Olympic Games creating phishing pages offering streaming services, tickets to events that won't have spectators, and even a fake virtual currency.

Criminals hacked into a Guntrader, a website used for buying and selling firearms, making off with a 111,000-entry database containing partial information from a CRM product used by gun shops across the UK.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Transnet suffers a disruption of its services allegedly due to a cyber attack.

Author: Multiple actors
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that scammers are already taking advantage of the hype surrounding Microsoft's next Windows release to push fake Windows 11 installers riddled with malware, adware, and other malicious tools.
A spammer floods the forum of the Babuk ransomware group with gay orgy porn GIFs after the Babuk gang failed to pay a $5,000 ransom demand.
The Microsoft security team said it detected a weeks-long email spam campaign abusing a technique known as “HTML smuggling” to bypass email security systems and deliver malware to user devices.
Florida's Department of Economic Opportunity (DEO) discloses a data breach that affected its unemployment benefits system and targeted 57,920 claimant accounts.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Defi protocol THORChain suffers another cyber attack and loses $8 million in a “seemingly whitehat” attack, with the attacker asking for a 10% bounty.
Counties Manukau DHB reports a possible data breach after detecting indications of unusual activity on its systems.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Emma Willard School is hit with a ransomware attack.
A petition website that demands an investigation into the US biological laboratory at Fort Detrick, is hit by two cyberattacks

Author: PHOBOS
Description: The Clinical Hospital in Bucharest is hit with a PHOBOS ransomware attack.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The City of Thessaloniki is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Apple releases security updates to address a zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild and impacting iPhones, iPads, and Macs.
The SBS News Instagram account is hacked. The attacker posts images of the popular fiction 'Vikings'.

Author: Praying Mantis AKA TG1021
Description: Researchers from Sygnia reveal the details of Praying Mantis, a new APT group carrying out attacks against Microsoft IIS web servers using old exploits in ASP.NET applications in order to plant a backdoor.
UC San Diego Health, the academic health system of the University of California, San Diego, discloses a data breach after the compromise of some employees' email accounts.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: A new version of the LockBit 2.0 ransomware is found that automates the encryption of a Windows domain using Active Directory group policies.

Author: BlackMatter
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future reveal the details of BlackMatter, a new Ransomware-as-a-Service willing to purchase access to corporate networks.

The FBI Criminal Investigative Division and Securities and Exchange Commission warn investors of fraudsters impersonating registered investment professionals such as investment advisers and registered brokers.
The LINE Instant Messaging accounts of more than 100 Taiwanese politicians and government officials have been hacked, and data exfiltrated from devices.
Target: More than 100 Taiwanese politicians and government officials
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: PKPLUG (aka Mustang Panda)
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal the details of PKPLUG, a Chinese group exploiting Microsoft Exchange Server vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-26855 and CVE-2021-27065 known as ProxyLogon), to deploy a previously undisclosed type of RAT.
Allegheny Intermediate Unit discloses a ransomware incident.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Homewood Health acknowledges it was hacked earlier this year, has the data dumped and starts to contact affected companies and agencies whose information may be compromised.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The City of Grass Valley discloses to have been hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: A Tallinn man is arrested in Estonia under suspicion that he has exploited a government photo transfer service vulnerability to download ID scans of 286,438 Estonians from the Identity Documents Database (KMAIS).
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Tortoiseshell AKA TA456 and Imperial Kitten
Description: Researchers from ProofPoint reveal the details of a new campaign carried out by the Iranian group Tortoiseshell to target employees and contractors working in defence and aerospace.
Target: Employees and contractors working in defence and aerospace
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Researchers from Sucuri discover a new card stealer malware campaign targeting Magento e-commerce sites, which loads the JavaScript hidden as an animation code.

Author: GhostEmperor
Description: Kaspersky announces its discovery of a unique, long-running operation, called GhostEmperor, using Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities to target high-profile victims with an advanced toolset.
Target: Targets in Southeast Asia, including several government entities and telecom companies

Description: Researchers from Inky reveal that hackers were able to compromise a Mailgun email marketing account belonging to the Chipotle food chain and used it to send out phishing emails, luring recipients to malicious links.
Researchers from Jfrog discover several Python packages aimed at stealing users' credit card numbers, Discord tokens, and granting code execution capabilities to attackers.
Security researchers from ThreatFabric reveal the details of Vultur, a novel piece of Android malware that uses the VNC technology to record and broadcast a victim’s smartphone activity.

Researchers from Recorded Future discover Spyware-like features inside an app named “Beijing One Pass” that foreign companies operating in China are forced to install on their systems in order to access a digital platform to manage employee state benefits.

Author: Ekipa
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new campaign targeting Russian and pro-Russian individuals via CVE-2021-26411.

Author: Solarmarker
Description: Researchers with Cisco Talos discover new activity from Solarmarker, a .NET-based information stealer and keylogger that they called "highly modular."

Author: APT29 AKA Cozy Bear
Description: Security researchers from RiskIQ discover more than 30 command and control (C&C) servers that have been actively used by APT29 to deliver the WellMess malware.

Author: BazaCall
Description: Researchers from Microsoft 365 Defender Threat Intelligence Team identify a new BazaCall campaign in which fake call centers are tricking victims into downloading malware, performing data exfiltration, and deploying ransomware on the affected machine.
Researchers from Cofense identify a new phishing scam that leverages the PayPal brand, and using automated scripts and live chat as a way of compromising devices and bypassing secure email gateways.

Researchers from Armorblox discover a credential phishing attack that spoofs a WeTransfer file-sharing notification. The email link leads to a phishing page replete with Microsoft Excel branding and aims to extract the victims’ O365 email credentials.
Researchers from Google shut down malicious ad posing as Brave browser but delivering malware.

Author: Avos Locker
Description: Coghlin Electrical Corp suffers an Avos Locker ransomware attack.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Sandhills Center is allegedly hacked by threat actors who claim to have exfiltrated 634 GB of data.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The Western Cape Blood Service (WCBS) confirms its information systems have been hit by a cyberattack.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The office of the Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul spent more than $2.5 million for cybersecurity after a ransomware hack in April that put the personal data of an unknown number of residents at risk.
Target: Office of the Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Renaissance Life & Health Insurance Company of America says they were notified by their vendor, Secure Administrative Solutions LLC (“SAS”), of a ransomware incident that involved unauthorized access to its systems occurred between March 15 and April 15, 2021.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: The Wisconsin Institute of Urology discloses a phishing incident.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Wayne County Hospital notifies 2,016 patients that their data may have been exposed after hackers launched a phishing attack on its employee emails.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Microsoft's Security Intelligence team issues an alert to Office 365 users and admins to be on the lookout for a "crafty" phishing email with spoofed sender addresses using phishing pages hosted on Google Cloud and Sharepoint.

Author: Cl0p
Description: Cayuga Medical Center joins the list of the victims of the Accellion data breach.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors are actively scanning for the Microsoft Exchange ProxyShell remote code execution vulnerabilities after technical details were released at the Black Hat conference.

Researchers from AT&T Alien Labs discover a new remote access trojan malware dubbed FatalRAT and distributed via forums and Telegram channels, hidden in download links that attempt to lure the user via software or media articles.
Paxton Media Group suffers a cyber attack that potentially compromised employees’ birthdates, Social Security numbers and banking data.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: The Lazio region in Italy (Regione Lazio) suffers a reported ransomware attack that disables the region's IT systems, including the COVID-19 vaccination registration portal.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author:
Gallium (AKA Soft Cell)
Naikon APT
TG-3390 (AKA APT27, Emissary Panda)
Description: Researchers from Cybereason reveal the details of DeadRinger, three cyberespionage campaigns focused on compromising networks belonging to major telecommunications companies.

Author: Raccoon Stealer
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover a new version of the Raccoon Stealer stealer-as-a-service upgraded by its developer in order to steal cryptocurrency alongside financial information.

Author: APT31 (AKA Zirconium, Judgment Panda, Red Keres)
Description: Researchers from Positive Technologies discover a new campaign by APT31 targeting organizations in Mongolia, Belarus, Canada, the United States, and Russia.
Target: Organizations in Mongolia, Belarus, Canada, the United States, and Russia

Author: TA428 and TaskMasters
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal the details of a series of campaigns carried out by two Chinese threat actors (TA428 and TaskMasters) targeting Russian government agencies.

UNM Health reveals that tithe data belonging to 637,252 patients was accessed and exfiltrated in May 2021, after a threat actor gained access to the health system’s network. The incident was not discovered until June 4, two months after the initial access began.
Target: UNM Health (University of New Mexico Health)
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Isle of Wight Education Federation (six schools) discloses that its IT systems were compromised last week by a ransomware attack which has encrypted its data.

Author: PYSA
Description: Children’s Network of Southwest Florida is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: PYSA
Description: Drug Alcohol Testing and Screening Compliance is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target: Drug Alcohol Testing and Screening Compliance

Description: Upstate Home Care is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.

Author: PYSA
Description: Bolton Street Pediatrics is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: PYSA
Description: Overlake Obstetricians & Gynecologists is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: PYSA
Description: Mid-Florida Pathology is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: PYSA
Description: St. Margaret’s Hospice is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: PYSA
Description: Bridgeway Inc. is listed among the victims of the PYSA ransomware.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Vision for Hope notifies to have suffered a phishing incident.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Cl0p
Description: Lehigh Valley Health Network notifies patients that their data was stolen in the Accellion data breach
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Italian energy company ERG reports "only a few minor disruptions" affecting its IT infrastructure following a ransomware attack on its systems.
Target_class: D Electricity gas steam and air conditioning supply

Author: Charming Kitten (AKA Phosphorus, TA435, and ITG18)
Description: Researchers from IBM X-Force discover LittleLooter, a backdoor used by the Iran-linked hacking group Charming Kitten to target individuals associated with the Iranian reformist movement.
Target: Individuals associated with the Iranian reformist movement

Author: BlackMatter
Description: ​The BlackMatter gang joins the ranks of ransomware operations to develop a Linux encryptor that targets VMware's ESXi virtual machine platform.

Author: StealthWorker botnet
Description: Taiwan-based NAS maker Synology warns customers that the StealthWorker botnet is targeting their network-attached storage devices in ongoing brute-force attacks that lead to ransomware infections.
Advanced Technology Ventures discloses a ransomware attack.
The Federal Trade Commission warns of phishing scams over unemployment benefits.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Eskenazi Health says an attempted ransomware attack caused the hospital to go on diversion.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Sanford Health sustains an attempted “cyber security incident” and is working to contain its impact.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) warns of an increase of LockBit 2.0 ransomware attacks against Australian organizations starting July 2021.

Author: Prometheus TDS
Description: Group-IB security researchers share the technical analysis of Prometheus TDS, an underground service that over the past several months has been used for the distribution of various malware families, such as Buer Loader, Campo Loader, Hancitor, IcedID, QBot, and SocGholish.

Author: China-Linked Threat Actor
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal the details of Four critical infrastructure organizations in a South East Asia
Target: Four critical infrastructure organizations in a South East Asia

Description: Researchers from Uptycs discover a crypto-mining botnet in June 2021 breaching Linux servers running Oracle WebLogic or Supervisord, downloading the Linux MSR driver, and then disabling hardware prefetching before installing a version of XMRig to mine cryptocurrency.

The University of Kentucky said it discovered a security breach of its Digital Driver’s License platform, one of the test-taking platforms, during a scheduled security penetration test. 350,000 individuals are affected.

Author: Kelvin Security
Description: The European Commission investigates a breach of its Cybersecurity Atlas project after a copy of the site’s backend database is put up for sale on an underground cybercrime forum.
Target_class: U Activities of extraterritorial organizations and bodies

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal  a rise in entertainment lures for fraud and phishing, including one campaign capitalizing on the buzz around “Friends: The Reunion.”

The Illinois State Police (ISP) confirms that their FOID (Firearm Owners Identification) card portal had been hit with a cyber attack, and that about 2,000 individuals may have had their information compromised.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: RansomEXX
Description: Taiwanese motherboard maker Gigabyte is hit by the RansomEXX ransomware gang, who threaten to publish 112GB of stolen data unless a ransom is paid.

Author: RansomEXX (or LockBit 2.0?)
Description: The RansomEXX ransomware gang leaks files stolen from Italian luxury brand Zegna.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Sittel, an Italian ICT company, is also allegedly hit in the same wave of ransomware attacks.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Tiscali, the Italian ISP, is also allegedly hit in the same wave of ransomware attacks.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: The Italian Notaries' Oder is also allegedly hit in the same wave of ransomware attacks.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Researchers from Juniper Threat Labs discover a campaign actively exploiting a critical authentication bypass vulnerability impacting home routers with Arcadyan firmware to take them over and deploy Mirai botnet malicious payloads.
Singapore telco StarHub reveals that personal data including mobile numbers and email addresses of 57,191 customers have been found on a third-party data dump website.

Author: ALTDOS
Description: OT Group, the Singapore real estate holding company of OrangeTee & Tie and OrangeTee Advisory, suffers a data security breach by the ALTDOS group.
The Italian ICT company Engineering Ingegneria Informatica discloses to have discovered a possible compromise of access credentials to some of their customers VPN.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Ibex discloses a security incident due to a malware attack occurred on August 2020.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: aw_cards
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a threat actor promotes AllWorld Cards, a new criminal carding marketplace by releasing one million credit cards stolen between 2018 and 2019 on hacking forums.
The Korean arm of French luxury brand Chanel issues an apology after personal data belonging to its customers was exposed after a cyber attack.

Author: FlyTrap
Description: Researchers from Zimperium discover a new Android threat called FlyTrap, hijacking Facebook accounts of users in more than 140 countries by stealing session cookies.

Author: APT29 AKA Cozy Bear, Nobelium, the Dukes
Description: Researchers from ESET and IstroSec reveal the details of a campaign carried out by APT29, targeting the Slovak government for months.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Researchers from Splunk discover a resurgence of a Crypto botnet targeting RDP servers on Amazon Web Services to mine cryptocurrencies.

Author: Water Kappa
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new malvertising campaign distribution the Cinobi banking trojan, stealing the credentials of 11 Japanese financial institutions.

Author: Hive
Description: The Hive ransomware gang claims to have hacked Greenway Health, despite it's not clear if the data belongs to Greenway Health or a former customer.

Author: eCh0raix
Description: A newly discovered eCh0raix ransomware variant has added support for encrypting both QNAP and Synology Network-Attached Storage (NAS) devices.

Author: Mr White Hat
Description: Poly Network announces it was attacked with $611M worth of cryptocurrency assets having successfully been transferred into the attackers' wallets. Few days after the hacker returns the stolen funds.
In its Patch Tuesday, Microsoft provides mitigation for a vulnerability under active attack.

Author: UNC215
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveals the details of UNC215, a Chinese cyber-espionage group targeting Israeli organizations, and often using false flags in attempts to disguise as an Iranian threat actor.

Author: Chaos
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new ransomware, under development, called Chaos, which is being advertised on an underground forum as being available for testing.
Children's Hospital of the King's Daughters notifies patients that their protected health information was exposed by an email phishing scam.
Target: Children's Hospital of the King's Daughters
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Accenture is hit by the LockBit 2.0 ransomware. The attackers leak 6 TB of files stolen and demand a $50 million ransom.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: AdLoad
Description: Researchers from SentinelOne discover a new AdLoad malware variant slipping through Apple's YARA signature-based XProtect built-in antivirus to infect Macs as part of multiple campaigns.

Author: Magniber
Description: Researchers from Crowdstrike discover a wave of Magniber ransomware attacks exploiting the PrintNightmare vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-1675, CVE-2021-34527, and CVE-2021-36958)

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes warn about the risks of rogue QR codes.
Third-party vendor and device manufacturer Electromed notifies 47,000 patients that their data was potentially compromised after a systems hack earlier this year.
Facebook reveals to have shut down a Russian campaign that claimed COVID-19 vaccine turns people into chimpanzees

A group of anonymous hackers from Belarus breaks into the national civil status system, and the data found shows that between March 2020 and March 2021, the death rate in the country is higher than about 14 times more than the authorities reported.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Waste Management Resources reveals that a data breach has exposed the healthcare information of current and former employees, as well as their dependents.
Target_class: E Water supply, sewerage waste management, and remediation activities

Description: Aqua Security’s threat research team uncover several supply chain attacks that use malicious container images containing crypto miners, hosted on Docker Hub.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal a new wave of attacks carried out by the Vice Society ransomware gang exploiting the PrintNightmare vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-1675, CVE-2021-34527, and CVE-2021-36958)
Researchers from Microsoft discover a phishing campaign using Morse code to encode the malicious HTM payload.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal that the LockBit 2.0 ransomware gang is not trying to fill the gap covered by the REvil ransomware gang.
Security vendor Trend Micro issues a warning for in-the-wild zero-day attacks hitting customers using its Apex One and Apex One as a Service products.

Author: Suspected Chinese government group
Description: A security researcher dubbed Imp0rtp3 discovers Tetris, a web attack framework developed by a suspected Chinese government hacking group, used to exploit vulnerabilities in 58 popular websites to collect data on possible Chinese dissidents.

Author: Aggah
Description: Researchers from Anomali discover a new campaign by Aggah, exploiting WordPress sites to deliver the Warzone RAT to manufacturing companies in Taiwan and South Korea.
Target: Manufacturing companies in Taiwan and South Korea

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Property maintenance company Phoenix Services joins the list of the LockBit 2.0 ransomware victims.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Painting supplies company Haydn joins the list of the LockBit 2.0 ransomware victims.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Inline Plumbing joins the list of the LockBit 2.0 ransomware victims.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Departments in Twin Falls County, Idaho, are not able to operate normally because of a cyber attack
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: DeepBlueMagic
Description: Researchers from Heimdal discover a new ransomware dubbed "DeepBlueMagic", which also deletes Volume Shadow copy for Windows, making recovery all but impossible without a decryption key.
A cache of 1.6 million emails allegedly stolen from the Lithuanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs is offered for sale on a data-trading forum.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The US Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) warns US brokerage firms and brokers of an ongoing phishing campaign impersonating FINRA officials and asking them to hand over sensitive information under the threat of penalties.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover various malicious campaigns abusing either legitimate challenge and response services (such as Google’s reCAPTCHA) or deploying customized fake CAPTCHA-like validation.
Researchers from Imperva reveal that bad bot activity rose on sporting and betting sites during sporting events such as Tour De France, EURO 2020 and the Tokyo Olympics.
Destination Maternity notifies 93,776 employees about an incident that occurred after an unauthorized party gained access to certain systems containing employee data.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The Research Foundation for the State University of New York disclosed to have suffered an unauthorized activity on its network between May 22, 2021 and July 9, 2021. 46,734 individuals are notified.
Target: Research Foundation for the State University of New York (SUNY)

Author: John Brinns
Description: T-Mobile investigates a data breach after a threat actor claims to have hacked T-Mobile's servers and stolen databases containing the personal data of approximately 50 million customers.
The Brazilian government releases a note stating the National Treasury has been hit with a ransomware attack on Friday (13).
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: Hive
Description: Memorial Health System is hit with a Hive ransomware attack.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: The sewage plant in Mount Desert is hit with a ransomware attack.

Description: The sewage plant in Limestone is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: E Water supply, sewerage waste management, and remediation activities

Description: A group of unknown hackers are found selling network access to the Pakistan Federal Board of Revenue on a Russian cybercrime forum.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: The Bar Ilan University is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: HolesWarm
Description: A new botnet named HolesWarm has been slowly growing since June this year, exploiting more than 20 known vulnerabilities to break into Windows and Linux servers and then deploy cryptocurrency-mining malware.
Tokio Marine Holdings, a multinational insurance holding company in Japan, announced this week that its Singapore branch, Tokio Marine Insurance Singapore (TMiS), suffered a ransomware attack.

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal an increase in LockBit 2.0 ransomware attacks in  Chile, Italy, Taiwan, UK.
Target: Targets in Chile, Italy, Taiwan, UK

Description: Researchers discover a new Trickbot campaign distributing Cobalt Strike via a fake 1Password installer.

Author: AvosLocker
Description: AvosLocker claims that they exfiltrated 60 GB of data from “Moorfields NHS UK & Dubai.”
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Fetch.ai is hit by a cyber attack and loses $2.6 million worth of its holdings.

Author: Siamesekitten (AKA Lyceum/Hexane)
Description: Researchers from ClearSky reveal that hackers associated with the Iranian government have focused attack efforts on IT and communication companies in Israel, likely in an attempt to pivot to their real targets.

Description: The Spanish National Police (Policía Nacional) and the Italian National Police (Polizia di Stato), in collaboration with Europol and Eurojust, dismantle an extensive network of cybercriminals linked to the Italian Mafia that was able to defraud their victims of roughly €10 million ($11.7 million) only in 2020.

CMA CGM is hit by another cyber attack, just under one year since its last big breach. The French containerline tells customers that it had suffered a leak of data on limited customer information involving first and last names, employer, position, email address and phone number.

Author: BlackMatter
Description: U.S. farmers cooperative NEW Cooperative suffers a BlackMatter ransomware attack demanding $5.9 million not to leak stolen data and provide a decryptor.
Target_class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Author: BlackMatter
Description: The BlackMatter ransomware gang hits Marketron, a business software solutions provider that serves more than 6,000 customers in the media industry.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal the details of BulletProofLink (also known as BulletProftLink and Anthrax), a large scale phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) operation.

Threat actors are compromising Windows IIS servers to add expired certificate notification pages that prompt visitors to download a malicious fake installer of  TVRAT (aka TVSPY, TeamSpy, TeamViewerENT, or Team Viewer RAT),
Multiple Russian government websites including the elections and state services portals are hit with a DDoS attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: McAllen Surgical Specialty Center discloses a ransomware attack. The data of 29,000 patients is potentially compromised.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Family Medical Center of Michigan (FMC) begins notifying patients that their financial information was exposed during a ransomware attack. The data of 20,000 individuals is compromised.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: ALTDOS
Description: ALTDOS claims to have hacked Sunway Group one of Malaysia’s biggest conglomerates

Author: FocaLeaks
Description: Hacktivists known as FocaLeaks claim to have hacked and exfiltrated data on 37,000 agents of Policía Nacional Civil de El Salvador (PNC).
Target: Policía Nacional Civil de El Salvador (PNC)
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Carmel Clay Schools discovers suspicious activity involving employee email accounts and notifies 15,817 individuals.

Author: Turla
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of TinyTurla, a previously undocumented backdoor used to target organizations in the U.S., Germany, and Afghanistan.
Target: Organizations in the U.S., Germany, and Afghanistan

Author: TAG-28
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group reveal that TAG-28, a China-linked group launched a cyber attack against India's largest media conglomerate, the Bennett Coleman And Co Ltd.

Author: TAG-28
Description: During the same operation, the Chinese attackers also hit the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) database, which contains a motherlode of biometric information.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: z0Miner
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover z0Miner, a new cryptojacker weaponizing the new CVE-2021-26084 Confluence vulnerability to mine for cryptocurrency on vulnerable machines.

Author: Emissary Panda (AKA APT27)?
Description: Researchers of eSentire reveal the details of an unusual ransomware attack mimicking the modus operandi of a state-sponsored operation.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: Cring
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal the details of a Cring ransomware attack where the attackers exploited two old Adobe ColdFusion vulnerabilities (CVE-2010-2861 and CVE-2009-3960).
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: Jupyter
Description: Researchers from Morphisec reveal the details of a new version of the Jupyter infostealer.

Simon Eye Management, a US chain of optometry clinics, reports a data breach potentially impacting more than 144,000 individuals, after unauthorized access to employee email accounts over a seven-day period between May 12-18, 2021.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Pottawatomie County suffers a ransomware attack.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Minnesota farming supply cooperative Crystal Valley suffers a ransomware attack.
Target_class: I Accommodation and food service activities

Author: Conti
Description: CISA, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), and the National Security Agency (NSA) warn of an increased number of Conti ransomware attacks targeting US organizations.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors have already started targeting Internet-exposed VMware vCenter servers unpatched against CVE-2021-22005.

Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign targeting JSC Makeyev Design Bureau, a known developer of liquid and solid fuel for Russia’s ballistic missiles and space rocket, via the recently discovered MSHTML Microsoft CVE-2021-40444 vulnerability.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign targeting the Russian Interior Ministry, via the recently discovered MSHTML Microsoft CVE-2021-40444 vulnerability.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: Debt-IN Consultants (Pty) Ltd, announces that a ransomware attack by cyber criminals has resulted in a significant data breach of consumer and employee personal information. More than 1.4 million South Africans are suspected to have been impacted.

USV Optical, Inc., a subsidiary of U.S. Vision, Inc., discloses that data belonging to 180,000 individuals (employees and patients) might have been accessed and possibly exfiltrated by an unauthorized individual from April 20, 2021, to May 17, 2021.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: FamousSparrow
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of FamousSparrow, a newly discovered cyberespionage group using the ProxyLogon exploit to target hotels worldwide, as well as higher-profile targets such as governments, international organizations, law firms, and engineering companies.
Threat actors hijack Bitcoin.org, the authentic website of the Bitcoin project, and alter its parts to push a cryptocurrency giveaway scam.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Apple releases security updates to fix CVE-2021-30869, a zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild by attackers to hack into iPhones and Macs.

Author: OpenSUpdater
Description: Google researchers discover a malware campaign exploiting malformed code signatures seen as valid in Windows to bypass security software. The tactic is actively used to push OpenSUpdater, a family of unwanted software that injects ads and installs unwanted programs onto the victims' devices.

Author: REvil AKA Sodinokibi
Description: Cybercriminals are slowly realizing that the REvil ransomware operators may have been hijacking ransom negotiations, to cut affiliates out of payments.

A suspected state-sponsored hacking group has attempted to breach the network of the Port of Houston, one of the largest port authorities in the US, using the CVE-2021-40539 zero-day vulnerability in Zoho.

Author: ZLoader
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover a new ZLoader campaign with a shift in delivery method: from the traditional email campaigns to the abuse of online ad platforms.

Author: APT36 (aka Mythic Leopard and Transparent Tribe)?
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of "Operation Armor Piercer”, a series of malicious attacks targeting Indian government and military personnel using commercial remote access Trojans (RATs) such as Netwire and Warzone (AKA AveMaria).
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Author: TangleBot
Description: Researchers from Cloudmark discover TangleBot, a new piece of mobile malware spreading via SMS and currently targeting Android mobile users in the United States and Canada
Target: Android mobile users in the United States and Canada

Description: Spanish authorities warn of a phishing campaign that impersonates messaging service WhatsApp in an attempt to trick recipients into downloading the NoPiques trojan.

Author: Ghostwriter
Description: The European Union officially links Russia to a hacking operation known as Ghostwriter that targets high-profile EU officials, journalists, and the general public.
Target: High-profile EU officials, journalists, and the general public.
Target_class: U Activities of extraterritorial organizations and bodies

Author: Vice Society
Description: ​California-based United Health Centers suffered a ransomware attack that reportedly disrupted all of their locations and resulted in patient data theft.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: MoneyLion locks the customer accounts that were breached in a credential stuffing attacks over the summer.
Crypto exchange Coinbase discloses that a threat actor stole cryptocurrency from 6,000 customers after using a vulnerability to bypass the company's SMS multi-factor authentication security feature.
Google releases Chrome 94.0.4606.61 for Windows, Mac, and Linux, an emergency update addressing CVE-2021-37973, a high-severity zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild.

Author: Conti
Description: GSS, the Spanish and Latin America division of Covisian, one of Europe’s largest customer care and call center providers, is hit by a Conti ransomware attack.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: Colossus
Description: Researchers from ZeroFox discover a new ransomware dubbed Colossus, targeting at least an automotive group of dealerships company in the US.
Target: Automotive group of dealerships based in the U.S.

Description: UK umbrella payroll firm Giant Pay is hit by a ransomware attack.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: UK Police issues an urgent warning after an elderly man is scammed out of £30,000 by phone fraudsters pretending to be from BT.
Eastern Los Angeles Regional Center notifies to have suffered a phishing attack compromising the data of nearly 13,000 individuals.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Council on Aging of Southwestern (COA) reveals to have suffered a phishing incident.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Golden Entertainment discloses a malware incident.
A ransomware attack disrupts the services at Coos County Family Health Services.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Desorden Group
Description: Desorden Group claims to have stolen 200 GB of data from ABX Express.
Target_class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: Tesuque Casino is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: RansomEXX
Description: The RansomEXX gang hits the Union of Reno Galliera (a union of eight towns in the metropolitan area of Bologna) and dumps 80Gb online.
Target_class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security

Description: Syniverse, a company that is a critical part of the global telecommunications infrastructure used by AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon and several others around the world discloses that hackers were inside its systems for years, impacting more than 200 of its clients and potentially millions of cellphone users worldwide.
Target_class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Author: APT29 AKA Nobelium, The Dukes, Cozy Bear
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover FoggyWeb, a new malware used by the Nobelium hacking group to deploy additional payloads and steal sensitive info from Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) servers.
Bandwidth.com becomes the latest victim of distributed denial of service attacks targeting VoIP providers.

Author: BloodyStealer
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover BloodyStealer, a new malware sold on dark web forums used by threat actors to steal accounts for multiple gaming platforms, including Steam, Epic Games Store, and EA Origin.
A malicious Firefox add-on named "Safepal Wallet" scam users by emptying out their wallets and lived on the Mozilla add-ons store for seven months.
Vista Radiology notifies 3,634 patients about a ransomware attack experienced on July which took part of its network offline.
Target_class: Q Human health and social work activities
