Meta removes 595 Facebook accounts, 21 Pages, four Groups and 86 accounts on Instagram from China for  coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Great Plains Manufacturing notifies 4,110 employees that some of their protected health information has potentially been compromised in a cyberattack that was discovered on October 11, 2021.
Blockchain startup MonoX Finance discloses that a hacker stole $31 million by exploiting a bug in software the service uses to draft smart contracts.

Author: APT27 AKA Emissary Panda
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover that an APT is exploiting CVE-2021-44077, an unauthenticated remote code execution issue in Zoho ServiceDesk Plus versions 11305 and older.

Author: Government of Mexico
Description: Twitter removes a network of 276 inauthentic accounts that shared primarily civic content, in support of government initiatives related to public health and political parties.

Author: People’s Republic of China
Description: Twitter removes a network of 2,048 accounts that amplified Chinese Communist Party narratives related to the treatment of the Uyghur population in Xinjiang. inauthentic accounts that shared primarily civic content, in support of government initiatives related to public health and political parties.

Author: People’s Republic of China
Description: Twitter removes a network of 112 accounts connected to “Changyu Culture,” a private company backed by the Xinjiang regional government.

Author: IRA (Internet Research Agency)
Description: Twitter removes a network of 16 accounts linked to the IRA that attempted an information operation in the Central African Republic.
Target: Twitter users in the Central African Republic
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: IRA (Internet Research Agency)
Description: Twitter removes a network of  50 accounts that attacked the civilian Libyan government and actors that support it, while voicing significant support for Russia’s geopolitical position in Libya and Syria.

Author: Tanzania
Description: Twitter removes a network of 268 accounts utilized to file bad faith reports on Twitter, targeting members and supporters of FichuaTanzania and its founder.

Author: Uganda
Description: Twitter removes a network of 418 accounts engaged in coordinated inauthentic activity in support of Ugandan presidential incumbent Museveni and his party, National Resistance Movement (NRM).

Author: Venezuela
Description: Twitter removes network of 277 Venezuelan accounts that amplified accounts, hashtags, and topics in support of the government and its official narratives via an app called Twitter Patria.

Author: Cuba
Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) reveals that the Cuba ransomware gang has compromised the networks of at least 49 organizations from US critical infrastructure sectors.
Target: At least 49 organizations from US critical infrastructure sectors.

Description: Resarchers from Mailguard discover a persuasive and ongoing series of phishing attacks use fake Office 365 notifications asking the recipients to review blocked spam messages to steal their Microsoft credentials.
Hackers steal an estimated $120 million worth of Bitcoin and Ether assets from Badger, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform.

Author: Magnat
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of Magnat, a campaign distributing fake versions of popular software to trick users into downloading three forms of malware.
Target: Victims in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia and Nigeria.

Author: Tor2Mine
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover a new variant of the Tor2Mine miner using a PowerShell script that attempts to disable malware protection, execute a miner payload and harvest Windows credentials

Author: Cuba
Description: The FBI warns that the Cuba ransomware gang has compromised at least 49 entities in five critical sectors in the U.S. as of November.
Target: At least 49 entities in five critical sectors in the U.S

Description: Researchers at Lookout identify a phishing campaign targeting members of the United States military and their families.
Target: Members of the United States military and their families
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Business software provider Zoho urges customers to update their Desktop Central and Desktop Central MSP installations to the latest available version after a critical vulnerability (tracked as CVE-2021-44515) is exploited in the wild.
The iPhones of at least nine U.S. State Department employees were hacked by an unknown assailant using the spyware developed by the Israel-based NSO Pegasus.
Target: At least nine U.S. State Department employees
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: BRATA
Description: Researchers from Cleafy discover a campaign in Italy exploiting the  BRATA Android remote access trojan (RAT), with threat actors calling victims of SMS attacks to steal their online banking credentials.
Accountancy firm Bansley and Kiener LLP announces it was the victim of a December 2020 ransomware attack.
Riverhead Central School District is hit with a ransomware attack.
Ulss 6 Euganea (a local national health unit) is hit with a cyber attack.
At least 18 fake birth certificates are generated in Hisar, after the Health Department is hacked.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Cryptocurrency exchange reveals that it was hacked for $150 million.
Researchers from Red Canary reveal that threat actors are distributing altered KMSpico installers to infect Windows devices with malware that steals cryptocurrency wallets.
A new phishing campaign has been targeting verified Twitter accounts

Author: RedLine
Description: Cybercriminals are spamming website contact forms and discussion forums to distribute Excel XLL files that download and install the RedLine password and information-stealing malware.
Approximately 330 SPAR shops in northern England face severe operational problems following a weekend cyberattack, forcing many stores to close or switch to cash-only payments.
A cyberattack takes Maryland’s health department offline.

Author: Nobelium
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the Nobelium hacking group continues to breach government and enterprise networks worldwide by targeting their cloud and managed service providers and using a new custom "Ceeloader" malware.

Author: Nobelium
Description: The French national cyber-security agency ANSSI (Agence Nationale de la Sécurité des Systèmes d'Information)says that the Russian-backed Nobelium hacking group has been targeting French organizations since February 2021.

Author: Nickel (AKA KE3CHANG, APT15, Vixen Panda, Royal APT, and Playful Dragon)
Description: Microsoft seizes dozens of malicious sites used by the Nickel China-based hacking group to target organizations in the US and 28 other countries worldwide.

Author: Conti
Description: Nordic Choice Hotels confirms a cyber attack on its systems from the Conti ransomware group.
Researchers from Sucuri reveal that threat actors are injecting credit card swipers into random plugins of e-commerce WordPress sites.

Author: Moobot
Description: Researchers from Fortinet reveal that a Mirai-based botnet called 'Moobot' is spreading aggressively via exploiting a critical command injection flaw in the webserver of many Hikvision products.

Researchers from Gemini Advisory reveal that threat actors have abused a legitimate feature of the Google Tag Manager service to secretly add and deploy malicious JavaScript code to more than 300 e-commerce stores since March this year.

Author: HelloKitty
Description: The Oregon Anesthesiology Group (OAG) said it suffered a ransomware attack in July that led to the breach of the personal information of 750,000 patients and 522 current and former OAG employees.

Author: Glupteba
Description: Google announces that it has taken action to disrupt the Glupteba botnet that controls more than 1 million Windows PCs around the world, growing by thousands of new infected devices each day.
QNAP warns customers today of ongoing attacks targeting their NAS devices with a cryptomining malware (oom_reaper), urging them to take measures to protect them immediately.

Author: Cerber
Description: The Cerber ransomware is back, as a new ransomware family with the old name, and targets Atlassian Confluence and GitLab servers using remote code execution vulnerabilities (respectively CVE-2021-26084 and CVE-2021-22205 for Confluence and GitLab)

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that US universities are being targeted in multiple phishing attacks, using COVID-19 Omicron lures, designed to impersonate college login portals to steal valuable Office 365 credentials.

Author: XE Group
Description: Researchers from Volexity reveal the details of XE Group, a Vietnamese-origin criminal threat actor linked to eight years of for-profit hacking and credit card skimming.

Author: Emotet
Description: The Emotet malware starts to install Cobalt Strike beacons directly, giving immediate network access to threat actors and facilitating ransomware attacks.
Sound Generations announces that unauthorized individuals have gained access to its internal systems and have used ransomware to encrypt files in two separate attacks.
Saltzer Health reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.
Boulder Neurosurgical and Spine Associates reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.
Region IV Area Agency on Aging reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.
Target: Region IV Area Agency on Aging

Description: Scammers are using fake job listings from multiple game studios including Riot Games to empty the wallets of young, hopeful victims looking to break into the gaming industry.
Pellissippi State Community College discloses a ransomware attack.
Eldon School District is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: Dark Mirai
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover that the botnet known as Dark Mirai (AKA MANGA, Dark.IoT) is exploiting a new vulnerability on the TP-Link TL-WR840N EU V5, a popular inexpensive home router released in 2017.
Researchers from jFrog discover 17 additional malicious npm packages caught stealing Discord tokens and environment variables.

Author: TAG-16
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future’s Insikt Group reveal the details of TAG-16, a Chinese state-sponsored group which has compromised several high-profile military and government organizations across Southeast Asia throughout 2021 using custom malware families such as FunnyDream and Chinoxy
Target: Several high-profile military and government organizations across Southeast Asia
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Suspected Chinese state-sponsored
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future’s Insikt Group discover a campaign carried out by a Chinese state-sponsored group targeting entities in Laos including the Cambodia’s Sihanoukville Autonomous Port (PAS).

Author: Suspected Chinese state-sponsored
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future’s Insikt Group discover a campaign carried out by a Chinese state-sponsored group targeting entities in Laos including the National Committee for Special Economic Zones (SEZs) and National Enterprise Database (NED)
North American food importer Atalanta admits that it suffered a data breach involving employees’ personal information as the result of a ransomware attack.
Valley Mountain Regional Center  notifies 17,197 patients that some of their protected health information was stored in email accounts that were accessed by unauthorized individuals.

Author: StrongPity AKA APT-C-41 and PROMETHIUM
Description: Researchers from Minerva Labs reveal the details of the latest campaign of the StrongPity APT using a malicious version of the popular Notepad++ application.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Security researchers discover a new ransomware written in Rust

Researchers from Wordfence detect a massive wave of attacks in the last couple of days, originating from 16,000 IPs and targeting over 1.6 million WordPress sites, targeting four WordPress plugins (PublishPress Capabilities, Kiwi Social Plugin, Pinterest Automatic, WordPress Automatic) and fifteen Epsilon Framework themes
Researchers from Cofense discover a new phishing campaign targeting German e-banking users, involving QR codes in the credential-snatching process.
Researchers from Avanan discover a phishing campaign taking advantage of the Outlook productivity features to make the spoofed message more credible.
Oahu Transit Services, a transport operator in Hawaii is hit with a possible ransomware attack.
The Municipality of Nowiny is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Snatch
Description: Swedish carmaker Volvo Cars discloses that attackers have stolen research and development information after hacking some of its servers.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors start to massively scan vulnerable Apache Log4j servers after a severe vulnerability is disclosed.

Author: Karakurt
Description: Researchers from Accenture reveal the details of Karakurt, a financially motivated threat actor, primarily using VPN credentials to gain initial access to a victim's network.

Author: Conti
Description: The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) says Conti ransomware attacks have targeted multiple Australian organizations from various industry verticals.

Author: Agent Tesla
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the Agent Tesla malware distributed in an ongoing phishing campaign that relies on Microsoft PowerPoint documents laced with malicious macro code.

Author: RansomEXX
Description: German logistics provider Hellmann Worldwide Logistics is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: Lapsus$
Description: The Brazil's Ministry of Health (MoH) suffers a ransomware attack, losing 50Tb of data including COVID/19 vaccination data.
Texas ENT Specialists announces it was the victim of a ransomware that was detected on October 19, 2021.
Howard University College of Dentistry discloses a ransomware attack.
BioPlus Specialty Pharmacy Services, LLC notifies patients of a recent data security incident that may have involved their information.
Standard Bank discloses a data breach on its LookSee platform.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Additional threat actors, including the Mirai and  Muhstik botnet start to scan systems for vulnerable  Apache Log4j servers.

The Python Package Index (PyPI) registry removes three malicious Python packages (aws-login0tool, dpp-client, dpp-client1234) aimed at exfiltrating environment variables and dropping trojans on the infected machines. The malicious packages are estimated to have generated over 10,000 downloads
Crypto platform AscendEX suffers an estimated $77.7 million worth loss after being hit by cyber attack.
Southern Orthopaedic Associates (SOA) notifies 106,910 patients about a breach of some of their protected health information.

Author: Khonsari
Description: Researchers from Bitdefender report the first public case of ransomware exploiting the log4shell vulnerability.
Workforce management solutions provider UKG discloses to have suffered a ransomware attack.

Author: TinyNuke
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign distributing the info-stealing malware TinyNuke, and targeting French users with invoice-themed lures.
Target: Corporate addresses and individuals working in manufacturing, technology, construction, and business services in France

Description: Google releases Chrome 96.0.4664.110 for Windows, Mac, and Linux, to address a high-severity zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild.
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Twitter account is hacked with a message declaring his country had adopted bitcoin as legal tender and was distributing the cryptocurrency to citizens.
Target: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Twitter account

Description: The Shelley School District is the victim of a ransomware attack.
ScansStat Technologies informs that bad actors posing as pharmacies had managed to get ScansStat to send them patient information.
The city of Lexington takes the majority of its Internet-connected services offline after discovering an "external interference."
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: TellYouThePass
Description: Threat actors revive an old and relatively inactive ransomware family known as TellYouThePass, deploying it in attacks against Windows and Linux devices targeting the critical remote code execution bug in the Apache Log4j library.
VulcanForged, a cryptocurrency gaming company is hit by hackers who steal more than $400 million.

Author: Threat actors originating from China, Iran, North Korea, and Turkey
Description: Researches from Microsoft reveal that nation-state attackers are now trying to exploit the log4shell vulnerability.
Opioid treatment network Behavioral Health Group suffered a cyberattack that led to an almost week-long disruption of IT systems and patient care.

Author: Anubis
Description: Researchers from Lookout discover a new Anubis campaign targeting the customers of nearly 400 financial institutions.

Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of Owowa, a malicious IIS web server module on Microsoft Exchange Outlook Web Access servers, used to steal credentials and execute commands on the server remotely.
Target: Servers in Malaysia, Mongolia, Indonesia, and the Philippines.

Author: MERCURY (aka MuddyWater, SeedWorm, or TEMP.Zagros)
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal the details of the latest campaign of the Iranian backed Seedworm group.
Target: Telecommunication and IT service providers in Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Pakistan, Thailand, and Laos

Author: DarkWatchman (Russian-speaking threat actor)
Description: Researchers from Prevailion identify DarkWatchman, a new malicious javascript-based Remote Access Trojan (RAT).

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Microsoft releases 67 security fixes including seven critical issues and a zero-day flaw (CVE-2021-43890) being actively exploited by cybercriminals.
Major natural gas supplier Superior Plus announces that it is suffering from a ransomware attack.
Virginia’s Division of Legislative Automated Systems is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target: Virginia’s Division of Legislative Automated Systems

Description: The Brazil's Ministry of Health (MoH) suffers a second cyber attack.

Author: Earth Centaur, previously known as Tropic Trooper
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal a resurgence of attacks carried out by the Earth Centaur threat actor.
Eastern Health suffers a cyber attack.
The North Shore Hebrew Academy High School is defaced with Nazi images.
Target: North Shore Hebrew Academy High School

Author: MERCURY (aka MuddyWater, SeedWorm, or TEMP.Zagros)
Description: Researchers from IBM X-Force reveal that the MuddyWater group is deploying a newly discovered backdoor named 'Aclip' that abuses the Slack API for covert communications, targeting an unnamed Asian airline.

Author: Conti
Description: ​Portland brewery and hotel chain McMenamins suffers a Conti ransomware attack that disrupts the company's operations.

Author: Emotet
Description: A new wave of Emotet attacks drop the Cobalt Strike beacons for faster attacks.
Researchers from Juniper reveal that threat actors exploiting the Apache Log4j vulnerability are switching from LDAP callback URLs to RMI to inject Monero miners.

Author: Charming Kitten
Description: Researchers from Check Point reveal that the Iran-linked hacking group Charming Kitten attacked seven Israeli targets including the Israeli "government and business sector".
Popular wrestling t-shirt site Pro Wrestling Tees discloses a data breach incident that has resulted in the compromise of the financial details of tens of thousands of its customers.
Regional Cancer Care Associates has some employee email compromised in a phishing attack.

Author: PseudoManuscrypt
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover the PseudoManuscrypt campaign targeting more than 35,000 computers in 195 countries.
Researchers from Avast reveal that a sophisticated threat actor has gained access and has backdoored the internal network of a US federal government agency.
Target: United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF)
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Twizt
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new variant of the Phorpiex botnet, known for its sextortion spam campaigns, crypto-jacking, cryptocurrency clipping and ransomware spread, called “Twizt” and using a peer-to-peer command and control infrastructure.

Author: Khonsari
Description: Microsoft urges admins of self-hosted Minecraft servers to upgrade to the latest release to defend against Khonsari ransomware attacks exploiting the critical Log4Shell security vulnerability.

Author: Cobwebs Technologies
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.

Author: Cognyte
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.

Author: Black Cube
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.

Author: Bluehawk CI
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.

Author: BellTroX
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.

Author: Cytrox
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.

Author: Unknown entity in China
Description: Facebook disrupts the operations of seven different spyware-making companies targeting roughly 50,000 Facebook users in over 100 countries around the world.
Four affiliated online sports gear sites disclose a cyberattack where threat actors stole credit cards for 1,813,224 customers.
Target:
Tackle Warehouse LLC
Running Warehouse LLC
Tennis Warehouse LLC
Skate Warehouse LLC

Description: An information technology system security breach prompts the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts to shut down its website for a state investigation,

Author: Noberus
Description: Researchers from Symantec reveal the details of Noberus, the first ransomware written in Rust.

Author: Egyptian Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that the iPhone of the Egyptian politician Ayman Nour was hacked by two different government hacking groups, using spyware made by NSO Group and Cytrox
Target: Ayman Nour (Egyptian politician vocal opponent of current President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi)

Author: Egyptian Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that the iPhone of the Egyptian politician Ayman Nour was hacked by two different government hacking groups, using spyware made by NSO Group and Cytrox
Target: Ayman Nour (Egyptian politician vocal opponent of current President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi)

Author: Egyptian Government?
Description: Citizen Lab finds traces of the Pegasus Spyware even in the phone of an anonymous Egyptian journalist.
VPN Solutions LLC is hit by a ransomware attack and multiple covered entities still can't access their data two month after the incident.

Author: Conti
Description: Researchers from AdvIntel reveal that the Conti ransomware operation is using the critical Log4Shell exploit to gain rapid access to internal VMware vCenter Server instances and encrypt virtual machines.

Author: Multiple APT actors
Description: The FBI's cyber division issues an alert warning enterprises using Zoho-owned ManageEngine's Desktop Central that advanced attackers have been exploiting CVE-2021-44515 to install malware since late October.

Author: Conti
Description: IT recruitment firm Finite Recruitment confirms it experienced a cyber incident in October, which resulted in a "small subset" of the company's data being downloaded and published on the dark web.

Author: APT10
Description: Researchers from SecurityScorecard discover malicious activity by the Chinese threat actor APT10 trying to exploit the Log4Shell vulnerability.

Author: APT28
Description: Researchers from SecurityScorecard discover malicious activity by the Russian threat actor APT28 trying to exploit the Log4Shell vulnerability.

Author: Turla
Description: Researchers from SecurityScorecard discover malicious activity by the Russian threat actor Turla trying to exploit the Log4Shell vulnerability.

Author: Ursnif
Description: Researchers from SecurityScorecard discover malicious activity by the Russian threat actor Ursnif trying to exploit the Log4Shell vulnerability.

Author: Grizzly Steppe
Description: Researchers from SecurityScorecard discover malicious activity by the Russian threat actor Grizzly Steppe trying to exploit the Log4Shell vulnerability.
The Medical Review Institute of America notifies patients of a ransomware incident.
The Joker malware is back again on Google Play, this time spotted in a mobile application called Color Message. The app was downloaded more than 500,000 times before its removal from the store.

Author: Sharp Boys
Description: A hacker group called Sharp Boys announces that it had hacked two Israeli hiking websites leaking the information of 100,000 users and offering the information of around three million people for sale.

Author: Sharp Boys
Description: A hacker group called Sharp Boys announces that it had hacked two Israeli hiking websites leaking the information of 100,000 users and offering the information of around three million people for sale.
DeFi protocol Grim Finance says about $30 million was stolen this weekend by hackers exploiting a vulnerability in their platform.

Author: Cl0p
Description: The Cl0p ransomware gang publishes confidential data held by UK Police on the dark web.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Belgium's ministry of defense confirms it was hit by a cyberattack, where threat actors allegedly exploited the Log4Shell vulnerability.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Ubisoft confirms a cyberattack on its IT infrastructure targeting the popular game Just Dance.

Author: BlackCat AKA ALPHV
Description: French IT services company Inetum Group is hit by a ransomware attack
A report from INKY reveal the details of a highly targeted phishing campaign impersonating Pfizer to steal business and financial information from victims.

Author: Dridex
Description: Threat actors are exploiting the critical Apache Log4j vulnerability (Log4Shell) to infect vulnerable devices with the notorious Dridex banking trojan or Meterpreter.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Meta, the parent company for Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, files a lawsuit against the operators of more than 39,000 phishing sites that have been hosted through the Ngrok service.
More than half a million patients are impacted by a data breach at US healthcare provider Texas Ear, Nose and Throat Specialists (Texas ENT).
Target: Texas Ear, Nose and Throat Specialists (Texas ENT)

Author: Kinsing
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal that the Kinsing miner botnet is dominating the attempts to exploit the Log4Shell vulnerability.
CompuGroup Medical is hit with a ransomware attack.
The Big White resort notifies of a potential data breach due to possible malware.
Coombe Women and Infants University Hospital confirms to have been hit with a ransomware attack.
Target: Coombe Women and Infants University Hospital

Description: Researchers from Group-IB, discover a worldwide scam campaign impersonating famous brands, and targeting users in over 90 countries all around the world, including the United States, Canada, South Korea, and Italy.

Researchers from Cado Security discover a new version of the Abcbot botnet, targeting insecure cloud instances running under Cloud Service Providers such as Tencent, Baidu, Alibaba Cloud, and Huawei cloud.

The Rhode Island Public Transit Authority sends out a notice saying that it identified a "security incident leading to the exfiltration of data including information about RIPTA health plans with Social Security numbers, addresses, dates of birth.

Author: UAE Government
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that the UAE used the NSO Group's Pegasus trojan to hack and track the phone of Hanan Elatr, wife of deceased Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
Target: Hanan Elatr, wife of deceased Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi

Description: Monongalia Health System suffers a data breach resulting from a phishing attack, which gave hackers access to several email accounts.
The UK National Crime Agency (NCA) and National Cyber Crime Unit (NCCU discover and donate to the community a 225 million cache of stolen emails and passwords.

Researchers from Sophos release details of a novel exploit that bypasses a patch for the critical vulnerability CVE-2021-40444 affecting the Microsoft Office file format, to install the Formbook malware.
The British Council has fallen victim to two successful ransomware attacks over the past five years.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Luxemburg-Casco School District discloses a data security incident that resulted in unauthorized access to 1,399 individuals’ personal information.
The Monterey Peninsula Unified School District notifies current and former employees of a data security incident that they discovered on or about November 1.
Welfare Pension and Annuity Funds of Local No ONE IATSE notifies 20,579 individuals about an email security incident that resulted in the exposure of sensitive data.
Target: Welfare Pension and Annuity Funds of Local No ONE IATSE

Author: Dridex
Description: A new Dridex malware phishing campaign is using fake employee termination emails as a lure to open a malicious Excel document, which then trolls the victim with a season's greeting message.

Author: Avos Locker
Description: A report from Sophos reveals that the AvosLocker ransomware gang has started focusing on disabling endpoint security solutions by rebooting compromised systems into Windows Safe Mode.
Researchers from Cofense discover a new phishing campaign targeting CoinSpot cryptocurrency exchange users
Millennium Eye Care discloses a ransomware incident.
A massive data breach exposes the data on the salaries and personal information of 637,138 Albanian residents working in the private and public sectors.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Elastic Security uncover a stealthy malware campaign that leverages valid code signing certificates to evade detection. The campaign is also used to drop a second stage payload called BLISTER.

Researchers from Cyble discover a new Android banking trojan targeting Itaú Unibanco and using a fake Google Play page to trick visitors into thinking they are installing the app from a trustworthy service.

Author: Rook
Description: Researchers from SentinelOne discover a new ransomware operation named Rook, derived from the leaked Babuk ransomware code.

Author: Polish Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that Polish Senator Krzysztof Brejza was hacked using the NSO Group's Pegasus spyware 33 times between April 26, 2019 and October 23, 2019.

Author: Polish Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that Pegasus was also used to hack into the phones of Polish prosecutor Ewa Wrzosek and Roman Giertych, a lawyer for Brejza's party Civic Platform.

Author: Polish Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that Pegasus was also used to hack into the phones of Polish prosecutor Ewa Wrzosek and Roman Giertych, a lawyer for Brejza's party Civic Platform.
Researchers from ReasonLabs discover a campaign inserting Monero miners to the Russian torrent files of the "Spider-Man: No Way Home" movie.
USCellular discloses a data breach after the company's billing system was hacked in December 2021 when the company detected an unauthorized access.
Researchers from Safeguard reveal that attackers are targeting crypto-wallets of Telegram users with the Echelon infostealer.

Author: Conti
Description: Photography and personalized photo giant Shutterfly suffers a Conti ransomware attack.

Author: Dridex
Description: A new Dridex malware phishing campaign exploits the Omicron COVID-19 variant lure.

ONUS, one of the largest Vietnamese crypto trading platforms, suffers a cyber attack on its payment system running a vulnerable Log4j version. The threat actors approached ONUS to extort a $5 million sum.
Capital Region Medical Center (CRMC) confirms it was the victim of a cyber attack.
Weddell Pediatric Dental Specialists notifies 5,356 individuals that an unauthorized individual gained access to an employee’s email account that contained their protected health information.
Duneland School Corporation notifies employees and dependents of a data breach.
The German Pharmacists’ Association (DAV) is the target of a phishing attack aimed to falsify vaccination data.

Author: eCh0raix AKA QNAPCrypt
Description: Users of QNAP NAS devices report attacks on their systems with the eCh0raix ransomware, also known as QNAPCrypt.
Several malicious campaigns are abusing the Microsoft Build Engine (MSBuild) to execute a Cobalt Strike payload on compromised systems.
Florida Digestive Health Specialists LLP notifies more than 212,500 individuals of a December 2020 breach involving business email compromise and fraud.

Author: BlackTech
Description: Researchers from NTT Security detect the BlackTech cyber-espionage APT group targeting Japanese companies using a novel malware that researchers call ‘Flagpro’.
T-Mobile confirms that recent reports of a new data breach are linked to notifications sent to a "very small number of customers" who fell victim to SIM swap attacks.
Many LastPass users report that their master passwords have been compromised after receiving email warnings that someone tried to use them to log into their accounts from unknown locations.
Amedia, the largest local news publisher in Norway, announces that several of its central computer systems were shut down in what it is calling an apparent “serious” cyberattack.

Researchers from Amnpardaz, an Iranian security company, discover iLOBleed, a rootkit that hides inside the firmware of HP iLO devices and which has been used in real-world attacks to wipe servers of Iranian organizations.

Author: AQUATIC PANDA
Description: Researchers from Crowdstrike reveal that the threat actor dubbed AQUATIC PANDA is trying to exploit the Log4Shell  CVE 2021-44228 vulnerability.
Brown County confirms a malware security breach occurred on August 2021.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority (SLGA) reports that it has temporarily disabled certain computer systems and applications, as it investigates a cybersecurity incident that occurred on Dec. 25.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Avos Locker
Description: The Avos Locker ransomware operation provides a free decryptor after learning they encrypted a US government agency.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Aquasec reveal the details of a cryptomining campaign targeting misconfigured Docker APIs and able to avoid detection since 2019.
Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Police is hit by an apparent cyberattack and data is put up for sale on the internet.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Crawford County Assessor’s Office is hit by a cyberattack.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Donnelley & Sons, a vendor of NJ Office of Information Technology suffers a cyber attack and all the activity is affected.
U.S. online store PulseTV discloses a large-scale customer credit card compromise with more than 200,000 shoppers impacted.
Singapore police warns of a spate of phishing SMS scams that affected at least 469 customers of OCBC Bank and resulted in losses of more than SG$8.5 million.

New Leaf, Inc., a non-profit provider of services to individuals with developmental disabilities, starts notifying 10,438 individuals that some of their protected health information was potentially compromised in a March 2021 ransomware attack.
The Gloucester City Council suffers a cyber attack.
Target_class: Public admin and defence, social security
